intro: Eleocharis argyrolepidoides, commonly known as the silver-leaved spike-rush, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its silver-gray appearance is due to the presence of fine, waxy hairs on the leaves and stems. Eleocharis argyrolepidoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
